Authors:
Ruvishika Shehali Jayawardena, Mei Liu, Maharachchikumbura
Sandeshya Maharachchikumbura, Wei ZHANG, QiKai Xing, Kevin D Hyde,
Somrudee Nilthong, XingHong Li, JiYe Yan
Title:
Vitis vinifera leaf spot disease caused by Neopestalotiopsis
vitis sp. nov. from China
Abstract:
Neopestalotiopsis is well known to be associated with the
diseases of grapevine in China. A new fungal species, Neopestalotiopsis
vitis was isolated from the grape leaf spot in Guangxi province, China.
Initially, small circular slightly sunken necrotic spots develop on the
leaf surface, mainly in the inter-vein regions. Later, the spots enlarge
rapidly and become brittle with age. Phylogenetic species recognition
based on multilocus analysis of the ITS, TUB2 and tef1 combined gene
sequences coupled with morphology distinguished N. vitis from other
species in the genus. This is the first report of Neopestalotiopsis
species causing a disease on leaves of grapevine in China.
